description.p: The invention relates to communications technologies, and in particular, to a rotation axis and a digital device.

With the continuous development of the communications technologies, the size of digital devices like Universal Serial Bus (USB) devices, data cards, and mobile phones becomes smaller. The requirements for components of the digital devices are therefore higher.

Currently, to increase the flexibility and ease of use of the digital devices, a component known as a rotation axis is almost used in all digital devices. The most commonly used rotation axis is a metal rotation axis.
During the implementation of the invention, the inventor finds at least the following weaknesses in the above prior art:
The structure of the existing metal rotation axis is complex; the size is large; the cost is high.

EP 1439317 A1 provides a hinge device for rotatably connecting a main body section (13) with a cover body section (12). The hinge device comprises a sleeve (6), a elastic body (4), a concave washer (2), and a movable support (3). The sleeve comprises a lip (56) and a cylinder (58). The elastic body, the movable support and the concave washer are disposed sequentially around the cylinder with the lip adjacent to the elastic body along an axial direction of the cylinder beginning with the lip. A number of concaves (32) are disposes on one end-surface of the concave washer and distributed on a circle, the end-surface of the concave washer where concaves are disposed contacts one end-surface of the movable support, and on the end-surface of the movable support, a number of protrusion (38) are disposed to mate the concaves. The fitting parts (40) of the movable support (3) are fitted into the respective fitting recessed parts (49) of the tubular member (5) and are movable in the axial direction. Following the rotation of the concave washer (2), the protrusion (38) repeatedly enter and escape from the concaves (32), and the fitting parts (40) of the movable support (3) slides in the fitting recessed parts (49) of the tubular member (5) to-and-fro in the axial direction.

US 2006210060 A1 provides a hinge device for rotatably connecting a stationary member with a rotary member. The hinge device comprises a sleeve (6), a elastic body (5), a protrusion washer (2), and a movable support (4). The sleeve comprises a lip (6B) and a cylinder (6A). A number of protrusions (2A) are disposes on one end-surface of the protrusion washer, the end-surface of the protrusion washer where protrusions are disposed contacts one end-surface of the movable support, and on the end-surface of the movable support, a number of concaves (4A) are disposed to mate the protrusions. The movable support (4) is fixed to the rotary member and the protrusion washer (2) is mounted on the stationary member via protrusions (2C) and mounting-holes (1B). The stationary member, the elastic body, the protrusion washer, the movable support and the rotary member are disposed sequentially around the cylinder with the lip adjacent to the elastic body along an axial direction of the cylinder beginning with the lip.

description.p: To better explain the purpose, technical solution and benefits of the invention, the embodiments of the invention will be described in detail with reference to the accompanying drawings.

FIG. 1 and FIG. 2 illustrate a rotation axis provided according to the first embodiment of the invention. The rotation axis includes a sleeve 101, an elastic body 102, a concave washer 103, and a movable support 104.
The sleeve 101 includes a lip 1011 and a cylinder 1012.

The elastic body 102, concave washer 103, and movable support 104 are disposed sequentially around the cylinder with the lip adjacent to the elastic body along the axial direction of the cylinder 1012 beginning with the lip 1011.

A number of concaves 1031 are disposed on one end-surface of the concave washer 103 and distributed on a circle. The end-surface of the concave washer 103 where concaves 1031 1 are disposed contacts one end-surface of the movable support 104. On this end-surface of the movable support 104, a number of protrusions 1041 are disposed to mate the concaves 1031.

Further, the rotation axis includes a stop ring 105. The stop ring 105 is disposed around the cylinder 1012 and located behind the movable support 104 along the axial direction. A stop groove 1051 is disposed on the stop ring 105.

Accordingly, a positioning rod 1043 is disposed on one end-surface of the movable support 104. The end-surface of the movable support 104 where the positioning rod 1043 is disposed contacts the stop ring 105.
Further, the rotation axis includes a positioning support 106 which is disposed around the cylinder 1012 and located behind the stop ring 105 along the axial direction.
Further, at least one positioning hole 1061 is disposed on the positioning support 106.
Further, the rotation axis includes a locking washer 107 which is disposed around the cylinder 1012 and located behind the positioning support 106 along the axial direction.
Further, the elastic body 102, concave washer 103, and movable support 104 are disposed around the cylinder 1012 with clearance fits.
The stop ring 105, positioning support 106, and locking washer 107 are disposed around the cylinder 1012 with interference fits.
Further, several positioning surfaces 1012b are disposed on the outer surface of the cylinder 1012.

Accordingly, positioning surfaces are disposed respectively on the inner surfaces of the concave washer 103, stop ring 105, positioning support 106, and locking washer 107 that contact the several positioning surfaces 1012b of the cylinder 1012. These positioning surfaces are referred to as positioning surfaces 103a, positioning surfaces 105a, and positioning surfaces 107a.
Further, the elastic body 102 is initially compressed.
Further, a through-hole 1012a is disposed in the middle of the cylinder 1012.
Further, at least one positioning hole 1042 is disposed on the positioning support 104.
The rotation axis provided according to the embodiment of the invention is applicable to digital devices such as USB devices, data cards, and mobile phones.

The rotation axis provided according to the embodiment of the invention is implemented with the parts including the sleeve, elastic body, concave washer, and movable support. It is characterized by simple structure, small size, low cost, and good reliability. The cooperation between the concaves, the protrusions, and the elastic body produces a hand feeling so as to realize the angle of each rotation of the rotation axis. In addition, any rotation angle range can be realized for the rotation axis by setting the angle of the stop groove on the stop ring. Further, by adjusting the length and elasticity coefficient of the elastic body or adjusting the depth of engagement between the concaves and protrusions, the required maximum torque can be obtained.

FIG. 3, FIG. 4, and FIG. 5 illustrate a rotation axis provided according to the second embodiment of the invention. The rotation axis includes a sleeve 201, an elastic body 202, a concave washer 203, a movable support 204, a stop ring 205, a positioning support 206, and a locking washer 207.

The sleeve 201 includes a lip 2011 and a cylinder 2012. A through-hole 2012a may be disposed in the middle of the cylinder 2012. In case of wiring, wires can be conveniently led through the through-hole 2012a.

Note the shape of the through-hole 2012a may be round, square, or rhombic. In the embodiment of the invention, the through-hole 2012a takes on a round shape. In other embodiments of the invention, the through-hole 2012a may take on other shapes. The shape of the through-hole 2012a is not limited by the embodiment of the invention.

The elastic body 202, concave washer 203, movable support 204, stop ring 205, positioning support 206 and locking washer 207 are disposed sequentially around the cylinder 2012 of the sleeve 201 from the lip 2011 along the axial direction of the cylinder 2012 beginning with the lip 2011.

An appropriate method is adopted to dispose the elastic body 202, concave washer 203, movable support 204, stop ring 205, positioning support 206 and locking washer 207 around the cylinder 2012 of the sleeve 201 so as to meet certain conditions. In particular, when the elastic body 202 and concave washer 203 are disposed around the cylinder 2012 of the sleeve 201, the disposition method must enable the elastic body 202 and concave washer 203 to move along the axial direction of the cylinder 2012 but not around the cylinder 2012; when the movable support 204 is disposed around the cylinder 2012 of the sleeve 201, the disposition method must enable the movable support 204 to move around the cylinder 2012 but not along the axial direction of the cylinder 2012; when the stop ring 205, positioning supporting 206, and locking washer 207 are disposed around the cylinder 2012 of the sleeve 201, the disposition method must enable the stop ring 205, positioning supporting 206, and locking washer 207 to move neither around the cylinder 2012 nor along the axial direction of the cylinder 2012.

In the embodiment of the invention, the disposition of the parts is as follows: the concave washer 203 is disposed around the cylinder 2012 of the sleeve 201 with a clearance fit, two positioning surfaces 2012b (longitudinally symmetric in the embodiment of the invention) are disposed on the outer surface of the cylinder 2012 of the sleeve 201, and two positioning surfaces 203a are disposed on the two inner surfaces of the concave washer 203 that contact the two positioning surfaces 2012b of the cylinder 2012, so that the concave washer can move to and fro along the axial direction of the cylinder 2012 but not rotate around the cylinder 2012; the elastic body 202 is disposed around the cylinder 2012 with an clearance fit, with one end of the elastic body 202 fixed to the lip 2011 of the sleeve 201 and the other end of the elastic body 202 fixed to the concave washer 203, so that the elastic body 202 can move to and fro along the axial direction of the cylinder 2012 together with the concave washer 203 but not rotate around the cylinder 2012. The movable support 204 is disposed around the cylinder 2012 of the sleeve 201 with a clearance fit so that the movable support 204 can rotate around the cylinder 2012 but not move along the axial direction of the cylinder 2012. The stop ring 205, positioning support 206 and locking washer 207 are fixed to the cylinder 2012 of the sleeve 201 with interference fits and positioning surfaces (positioning surfaces 205a, positioning surfaces 206a, and positioning surfaces 207a) are disposed on the two inner surfaces of the stop ring 205, positioning support 206 and locking washer 207 that contact the two positioning surfaces 2012b of the cylinder 2012, so that the stop ring 205, positioning support 206 and locking washer 207 can be relatively still to the sleeve 201, that is, the stop ring 205, positioning support 206 and locking washer 207 will not rotate around the cylinder 2012 or move along the axial direction of the cylinder 2012.

Note the elastic body 202, concave washer 203, movable support 204, stop ring 205, positioning support 206 and locking washer 207 may be disposed around the cylinder 2012 of the sleeve 201 in other methods to meet the above conditions. For example, one positioning surface is disposed on each part, or three or four or other numbers of positioning surfaces are disposed on each part; or the stop ring 205, positioning support 206 and locking washer 207 are welded fixedly to the cylinder 2012. The disposition of the parts is not limited to the method provided in the embodiment of the invention. The disposition can be flexible according to practical conditions.
The elastic body 202 is initially compressed to provide a certain pressing force.

Specifically, the initial state is the state where the elastic body 202 is originally assembled to the rotation axis. The elastic body 202 may be a spring or other structures that provide an elastic force.
A number of concaves 2031 are disposed on the end-surface of the concave washer 203 that contacts the movable support 204.

The concaves 2031 on the concave washer 203 may be distributed and distributed on a circle. The concaves 2031 may be distributed evenly or not distributed evenly on a circle of a certain diameter. The diameter depends on the size and the practical application of the concave washer 203. The diameter is not limited here. The concave washer 203 may be a thin slice in a round, square, or rhombic shape with a round hole in the center. The diameter of the round hole is slightly larger than that of the cylinder 2012, so that the concave washer 203 can be disposed around the cylinder 2012 and move to and fro along the axial direction of the cylinder 2012 but not rotate around the cylinder 2012. In the embodiment of the invention, the concave washer 203 is preferably a round slice with a round hole in the center.
Accordingly, a number of protrusions 2041 are disposed on the end-surface of the movable support 204 that contacts the concave washer 203 to mate the concaves 2031.

Particularly, when the movable support 204 is rotated around the cylinder 1012, the protrusions 2041 can be rotated into or out of the concaves 2031. Through the cooperation of the protrusions 2041, concaves 2031, and elastic force of the elastic body 202, the elastic body 202 and concave washer 203 can move to and fro along the axial direction of the cylinder 2012. The number and distribution of the protrusions 2041 may depend on the number and distribution of the concaves 2031. Generally, the number of protrusions 2041 is smaller than or equal to the number of concaves 2031. For example, if 12 concaves 2031 are distributed evenly on a circle of a certain diameter with an angle of 30 degrees between each two adjacent concaves 2031, 12 protrusions 2041 can be designed accordingly with an angle of 30 degrees between each two adjacent protrusions 2041, or 4 protrusions 2041 can be designed with an angle of 90 degrees between each two adjacent protrusions 2041. If the concaves 2031 on the concave washer 203 are not evenly distributed on a circle of a certain diameter, the number of protrusions 2041 may only be 1.

In the embodiment of the invention, the protrusions 2041 are rotated into the concaves 2031 initially; when the protrusions 2041 on the movable support 204 are rotated relatively to the concaves 2031 on the concave washer 203, with the cooperation of the elastic force provided by the elastic body 202, the protrusions 2041 are rotated into the concaves 2031 and rotated out of the concaves 2031 constantly. That is, the protrusions 2041 and the concaves 2031 are constantly interlocked and separated and such changes produce a hand feeling. The angle of each move of the movable support 204 relative to the concave washer 203 (the process where protrusions 2041 are moved out of the concaves 2031 and moved into the concaves 2031 again) can be adjusted by changing the number and positions of the concaves 2031 on a circle of a certain diameter. For example, if the angle between each two adjacent concaves 2031 is 30 degrees, the angle of each move of the movable support 204 relative to the concave washer 203 is 30 degrees. The angle of each move of the movable support 204 relative to the concave washer 203 may be described as a working range angle. Changing the number and distribution of the concaves 2031 on the concave washer 203 can adjust the working range angle of the rotation axis. In addition, the torque that enables the protrusions 2041 of the movable support 204 to move completely out of the concaves 2031 of the concave washer 203 is the maximum torque of the rotation axis. The maximum torque can be controlled by changing the elasticity coefficient of the elastic body 202 and the size of the protrusions 2041 and concaves 2031. To help the protrusions 2041 to move into and move out of the concaves 2031, the depth of the concaves 2031 is generally not large and the diameter of the protrusions 2041 is larger than the depth of concaves 2031.

The movable support 204 may be a thin slice in a round, square, or rhombic shape with a round hole in the center and the diameter of the round hole is larger than the diameter of the cylinder 2012 so that the movable support 204 can be disposed around the cylinder 2012 and can rotate around the cylinder 2012. In the embodiment of the invention, the movable support 204 is a round slice with a round hole in the center. In addition, when the rotation axis provided according to the embodiment of the invention is applied to other devices, to help the connection with the other devices, at least one positioning hole 2042 may be disposed on the movable support 204. As shown in FIG. 3 and FIG. 4, a pair of positioning holes 2042 is disposed on two sides of the movable support 204.
A stop groove 2051 is disposed on the stop ring 205 and a positioning rod 2042 is disposed on the end-surface of the movable support 204 that contacts the stop ring 205.

When the positioning rod 2042 on the movable support 204 contacts the edge of the stop groove 2051 on the stop ring 205, the movable support 204 cannot move in the previous moving direction. Thereby, the stop groove 2051 on the stop ring 205 will limit the move of the positioning rod 2042 on the movable support 204 to a certain angle range. That is, the angle of the stop groove 2051 on the stop ring 205 decides the rotation angle range of the movable support 204. For example, if the angle of the stop groove 2051 on the stop ring 205 is 270 degrees, the rotation angle range of the movable support 204 is from 0 to 270 degrees.

Note when no stop ring 205 is disposed, the invention can still be implemented but, in this case, the movable support 204 can rotate by any angle clockwise or anticlockwise. When a through-hole 2012a is disposed in the middle of the cylinder 2012 and wires are led through the through-hole 2012a, the wires will be hinged.

At least one positioning hole 2061 is disposed on the positioning support 206. When the rotation axis is applied in another device, the positioning hole 2061 of the positioning support 206 can fasten the entire rotation axis to the other device.

Note the fastening of the rotation axis is not limited to the disposition of the positioning hole 2061 but may be implemented in other methods in the prior art, for example, the use of a positioning bolt or interference fit. The design can be flexible according to the practical conditions. In addition, when no positioning support 206 is disposed, the invention can still be implemented. In this case, when the rotation axis is applied in another device, the rotation axis is fastened through other parts in the axis, for example, a positioning hole disposed on the lip 2011 of the sleeve 201.

The locking washer 207 can compress and dispose the elastic body 202, concave washer 203, movable support 204, stop ring 205, and positioning support 206 around the cylinder 2012 of the sleeve 201 and force the elastic body 202 to be compressed in the initial state to provide an initial pressing force.

Note, when no locking washer 207 is disposed, the invention can still be implemented in various methods in the prior art. For example, the elastic body 202, concave washer 203, movable support 204, stop ring 205, and positioning support 206 can be compressed around the cylinder 2012 of the sleeve 201 and the end of the cylinder 2012 is turned outward and fixed to the positioning support 206; or, after the elastic body 202, concave washer 203, movable support 204, stop ring 205, and positioning support 206 are compressed around the cylinder 2012 of the sleeve 201, the stop ring 205 and positioning support 206 are welded to the cylinder 2012.

The working principle of the rotation axis provided according to the embodiment of the invention is as follows:
In the initial state, the protrusions 2041 on the movable support 204 are rotated in the concaves 2031 on the concave washer 203 and the elastic body 202 is compressed to provide an initial pressing force. When the movable support 204 is rotated, the protrusions 2041 on the movable support 204 are rotated out of the concaves 2031 on the concave washer. In this case, the concave washer 203 is pressed by the protrusions 2041 on the movable support 204 and moves toward the elastic body 202 to compress the elastic body 202. The elastic body 202 is compressed by a larger force and the elastic force is greater. When the movable support 204 is rotated again, the protrusions 2041 on the movable support 204 are moved into the next concaves 2031 and the concave washer 203 moves away from the elastic body 202 under the elastic force of the elastic body 202. Thus, the elastic body 202 is less compressed and the elastic force is weaker. During the rotation of the movable support 204, as a protrusion 2041 is moved out of a concave 2031 and moved into the next concave 2031, the concave washer 203 moves to and fro along the axial direction of the cylinder 2012 and the compression of the elastic body 202 is larger and smaller accordingly. Such changes produce a hand feeling. When the movable support 204 is rotated so that the positioning rod 2042 contacts the edge of the stop groove 2051 of the stop ring 205, the rotation of the movable support 204 is stopped and the maximum rotation angle is reached.

The material of the rotation axis is not limited and the material may be metal or plastic. The rotation axis may be made through metal stamping or powder metallurgy. The rotation axis is applicable to digital products such as USB flash disks, data cards, and mobile phones.

The rotation axis provided according to the embodiment of the invention is implemented with the parts including the sleeve, elastic body, concave washer, and movable support. It is characterized by simple structure, small size, low cost, and good reliability. The cooperation between the concaves, the protrusions, and the elastic body produces a hand feeling so as to realize the angle of each rotation of the rotation axis. In addition, any rotation angle range can be realized for the rotation axis by setting the angle of the stop groove on the stop ring. Further, by adjusting the length and elasticity coefficient of the elastic body or adjusting the depth of engagement between the concaves and protrusions, the required maximum torque can be obtained.
The invention will be described further with an exemplary embodiment where the rotation axis is applied in a data card.
FIG. 6 to FIG. 10 illustrate a data card provided according to the third embodiment of the invention. The data card includes a data card rotating USB head 30 and a data card body 40.

The rotating USB head 30 includes a USB connector 301, a rotation axis 302, a connecting wire 303, a USB upper support 304, and a USB lower support 305. The rotation axis 302 includes a sleeve 201, an elastic body 202, a concave washer 203, a movable support 204, a stop ring 205, a positioning support 206, and a locking washer 207. The structures and functions of the parts of the rotation axis 302 are the same as those in the second embodiment and will not be repeated here. The data card body 40 includes a Printed Circuit Board (PCB) 401, a data card upper shell 402, and a data card lower shell 403.
The positioning support 206 of the rotation axis 302 is fixed to the data card upper shell 402 so that the positioning support 206 is fastened to the data card body 40.

Particularly, fixing the positioning support 206 to the data card upper shell 402 may include: welding the positioning support 206 to the data card upper shell 402; or designing two positioning holes 2061 on the positioning support 206 and fixing the positioning support 206 to the data card upper shell 402 with two screws; or fixing the positioning support 206 to the data card upper shell 402 in various methods provided in the prior art. The method is not limited. If no positioning support 206 is disposed in the rotation axis 302, the lip 2011 of the sleeve 201 may be fixed to the data card upper shell 402 in a similar method.
The movable support 204 of the rotation axis 302 is fixed to the USB lower support 305 so that the movable support 204 is fixed to the rotating USB head 30.

Particularly, a method similar to fixing the positioning support 206 to the data card upper shell 402 may be adopted to fix the movable support 204 to the USB lower support 305. The method will not be detailed here.

The USB connector 301 is connected to one end of the connecting wire 303. The other end of the connecting wire 303 is led through the through-hole 2012a in the cylinder 2012 and connected to the PCB 401.
Particularly, the connecting wire 303 may be connected to the USB connector 301 and the PCB 401 through welding or clamping. The connection mode is not limited.

The conduction between the USB connector 301 and the rotation axis 302 is implemented through a conductor and the conduction between the rotation axis 302 and the PCB 401 is achieved through another conductor.

Particularly, a conductor such as a metal spring may be used to implement conduction between the rotation axis 302 and the USB connector 301 and between the rotation axis 302 and the PCB 401 so that the rotation axis 302 is grounded.

The USB connector 301 is located between the USB upper support 304 and the USB lower support 305. The USB upper support 304 and the USB lower support 305 are fastened together to protect and fix the USB connector 301.

The working principle of the data card provided according to the embodiment of the invention is as follows: when the rotating USB head 30 is rotated, the movable support 204 of the rotation axis 302 rotates relatively to the concave washer 203 so that the rotating USB head 30 rotates relatively to the data card body 40. With the hand feeling, working range angle and maximum rotation angle provided by the rotation axis 302, the rotating USB head 30 rotates relatively to the data card body 40.

With a rotation axis that includes such parts as the sleeve, elastic body, concave washer, and movable support, the data card provided according to the embodiment of the invention can rotate by any angle and be characterized by simple structure, small size, low cost, and good reliability.
The invention will be described further with an exemplary embodiment where the rotation axis is applied in a USB connector adapter.

FIG. 11 to FIG. 15 illustrate a USB connector adapter provided according the fourth embodiment of the invention. The USB connector adapter includes an adapter head USB A-part 50 and an adapter head USB B-part 60.

The adapter head USB A-part 50 includes a USB A connector 501, a USB A upper support 502, a USB A lower support 503, a rotation axis 504, and a connecting wire 505. The rotation axis 504 includes a sleeve 201, an elastic body 202, a concave washer 203, a movable support 204, a stop ring 205, a positioning support 206, and a locking washer 207. The structures and functions of the parts of the rotation axis 504 are the same as those in the second embodiment and will not be repeated here. The adapter head USB B-part 60 includes a USB B upper support 601, a USB B lower support 602 and a USB B connector 603.
The positioning support 206 of the rotation axis 504 is fixed to the USB A lower support 503 so that the positioning support 206 is fixed to the adapter head USB A-part 50.

Particularly, a method similar to fixing the positioning support 206 to the data card upper shell 402 in the third embodiment may be adopted to fix the positioning support 206 to the USB A lower support 503.
The movable support 204 of the rotation axis 504 is fixed to the USB B lower support 602 so that the movable support 204 is fixed to the adapter head USB B-part 60.
Particularly, a method similar to fixing the movable support 204 to the USB lower support 305 in the third embodiment may be adopted to fix the movable support 204 to the USB B lower support 602.

The USB A connector 501 is connected to one end of the connecting wire 505. The other end of the connecting wire 505 is led through the through-hole 2012a in the cylinder 2012 and connected to the USB B connector 603.
Particularly, the connecting wire 505 may be connected to the USB A connector 501 and the USB B connector 603 through welding or clamping. The connection mode is not limited.

The USB A connector 501 is located between the USB A upper support 502 and the USB A lower support 503. The USB A upper support 502 and the USB A lower support 503 are fastened together to protect and fix the USB A connector 501.

The USB B connector 603 is located between the USB B upper support 601 and the USB B lower support 602. The USB B upper support 601 and the USB B lower support 602 are fastened together to protect and fix the USB B connector 603.

The working principle of the USB connector adapter provided according to the embodiment of the invention is as follows: when the adapter head USB B-part 60 is rotated, the movable support 204 of the rotation axis 504 rotates relatively to the concave washer 203 so that the adapter head USB B-part 60 rotates relatively to the adapter head USB A-part 50. With the hand feeling, working range angle and maximum rotation angle provided by the rotation axis 504, the adapter head USB B-part 60 rotates relatively to the adapter head USB A-part 50.

With a rotation axis that includes such parts as the sleeve, elastic body, concave washer, and movable support, the USB connector adapter provided according to the embodiment of the invention can rotate by any angle and be characterized by simple structure, small size, low cost, and good reliability.
FIG. 16 illustrates a USB device provided according to the fifth embodiment of the invention. The USB device includes a USB plug 70, a rotating structure 80, and a device body 90.

The USB plug 70 is fixedly connected to the rotating structure 80. The rotating structure 80 includes a rotating unit 801. The rotating structure 80 and the device body 90 are connected via the rotating unit 801. The rotating structure 80 rotates on a side of the device body 90 through the rotating unit 801.

The rotating unit 801 is the same as the rotation axis in the first and second embodiments of the invention. It is understandable that the rotating unit of the USB device in the embodiment of the invention may be a gear driven or spring-driven rotating unit. The rotating unit of the USB device in the embodiment of the invention is not limited.
A holding groove 901 is disposed on the device body 90. The USB plug 70 and the rotating structure 80 can be held in the holding groove 901 through rotation to integrate with the device body 90.

With a rotation axis that includes such parts as the sleeve, elastic body, concave washer, and movable support, the USB device provided according to the embodiment of the invention can rotate by any angle and be characterized by simple structure, small size, low cost, and good reliability.
The embodiments of the invention may be implemented through software. The software program may be stored in a readable storage medium, such as a hard disk, a cache or a compact disk.

Although the invention has been described through some preferred embodiments, the invention is not limited to such embodiments. It is apparent that those skilled in the art can make various modifications and variations thereto without departing from the scope of the invention. The invention is intended to cover the modifications and variations provided that they fall within the scope of protection defined by the claims or their equivalents.

claim.claim-text: Drehwelle nach Anspruch 1, die ferner einen Anschlagring umfasst, wobei: der Anschlagring (105, 205) um den Zylinder (1012; 2012) angeordnet ist und sich entlang der axialen Richtung hinter der beweglichen Stütze (104; 204) und vor der Positionierungsstütze (106; 206) befindet und eine Anschlagnut (1051, 2051) in dem Anschlagring angeordnet ist; und demgemäß ein Positionierungsstab (1043; 2043) an einer Stirnfläche der beweglichen Stütze angeordnet ist, wobei sich die Stirnfläche der beweglichen Stütze dort, wo sich der Positionierungsstab befindet, mit dem Anschlagring in Kontakt befindet; und die Anschlagnut die Bewegung des Positionierungsstabs der beweglichen Stütze (104; 204) auf einen bestimmten Winkelbereich einschränkt.
Drehwelle nach Anspruch 2, wobei in der Positionierungsstütze (106; 206) wenigstens ein Positionierungsloch (1061; 2061) angeordnet ist.

Drehwelle nach Anspruch 2, die ferner eine Verriegelungsunterlegscheibe (107; 207) umfasst, wobei: die Verriegelungsunterlegscheibe (107; 207) um den Zylinder (1012; 2012) angeordnet ist und sich entlang der axialen Richtung hinter der Positionierungsstütze (106; 206) befindet.

der Anschlagring, die Positionierungsstütze (106; 206) und die Verriegelungsunterlegscheibe (107; 207) mit Presspassungen um den Zylinder (1012; 2012) angeordnet sind.

Drehwelle nach Anspruch 5, wobei eine Anzahl von Positionierungsflächen (1012b; 2012b) auf einer Außenfläche des Zylinders (1012; 2012) angeordnet ist; und
demgemäß
Positionierungsflächen (103a, 105a, 106a, 107a, 203a, 205a, 206a, 207a) auf einer Anzahl von Innenflächen der Unterlegscheibe (103; 203) mit Aushöhlungen, dem Anschlagring, der Positionierungsstütze (106; 206) und der Verriegelungsunterlegscheibe (107; 207) angeordnet sind und sich mit den Positionierungsflächen des Zylinders (1012; 2012) in Kontakt befinden.
